title: Double decker bus crashes and overturns as police declare major incident
text:
Police have declared a major incident today after a double decker bus overturned into a field and trapped up to 20 passengers.

The horror crash happened just before 11am on the A385 between Totnes and Paignton in Devon.

Pictures appear to show the Stagecoach Gold bus burst through a hedge and overturned in the field near Lombcrombe Cross.

Scroll for video

The incident (pictured) is believed to have happened just before 11am on the A385 between Totnes and Paignton in Devon. It is as yet unclear how many people have been hurt

Pictures appear to show the Stagecoach Gold bus burst through a hedge and overturned in the field

Police said one person has been seriously injured and up to a dozen more were hurt. Pictured: The aftermath

Police said one person has been seriously injured and up to a dozen more were hurt.

Some passengers had to be dragged from the wreckage by fire crews.

A witness told Devon Live: 'Very bad accident outside Totnes.

'There are many people with very severe injuries. Maybe 20 with some trapped.

A witness said: 'Very bad accident outside Totnes. 'There are many people with very severe injuries. Maybe 20 with some trapped'

Emergency services have been pulling passengers from the wreckage this afternoon (pictured)

'I was passing and stopped to help but a lot of people too injured to move.'

A Devon and Cornwall Police spokesman said: 'A double-decker bus has overturned and a number of passengers have sustained injuries.

'Currently we believe that one person has sustained serious injuries.

'We also have over a dozen people who have sustained minor injuries and remain at the scene.'

It was reported that up to four air ambulances were also dealing with the 'major incident'.

A Devon and Cornwall Police spokesman said: 'A double-decker bus has overturned and a number of passengers have sustained injuries'

Gerald Taylor, Area Manager for Devon & Somerset Fire and Rescue Service, tweeted: 'All casualties are cleared from the bus and are now being treated by SWAST'

A spokesman for Stagecoach South West said: 'We can confirm one of our buses has been involved in an incident on the A385 between Paignton and Totnes'

Gerald Taylor, Area Manager for Devon & Somerset Fire and Rescue Service, tweeted: 'All casualties are cleared from the bus and are now being treated by SWAST.'

A spokesman for Stagecoach South West said: 'We can confirm one of our buses has been involved in an incident on the A385 between Paignton and Totnes.

'Emergency services are at the scene. Our immediate thoughts are for those involved and we are helping the emergency services in any way that we can.

'Safety is our absolute priority and we will be assisting the investigation into the circumstances involved in the incident.'

Police said road closures remained in place near the scene and advised drivers to avoid the area.
description: The incident is believed to have happened just before 11am on the A385 between Totnes and Paignton in Devon.
